channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘We’ve had two cars for 40 years’: With congestion charges, insurance and gas prices — should we sell our second car? Or will we regret it?
item.description: “I’m semi-retired working about 20 hours a month at my own business.”

item.title: Rise in U.K. Gilt Yields Mirror Increase in U.S. Treasury Yields
item.description: The rise in gilt yields has mirrored a rise in Treasury yields, Quilter Investors said, adding that a key factor remained the sheer size of bond sales...

item.title: U.S. Companies and Investors in Japan Are at Risk From U.S. Steel Backlash
item.description: American investment could become less welcome, undermining Japan’s progress on corporate reforms.

item.title: Nordic Banks Under Continued Pressure From Lower Interest Rates
item.description: The impact of lower interest rates in the fourth quarter sees a continuation of the challenging operating environment for Nordic banks, Jefferies said...

item.title: Most of the ‘Sweet 16’ stocks have dominated. They might do it again in 2025.
item.description: This group was first identified by Jefferies in September 2020 and included Nvidia long before the company’s growth explosion began.

item.title: Wildfires Are Making Investors Nervous About Los Angeles Area Utility Again
item.description: Southern California’s Edison International owes its survival to luck, at least in part.

item.title: Eggs over potato chips: Brits are getting healthier but not happier, top retailers say
item.description: Brits are getting healthier but not happier, according to updates from three of the company’s biggest food outlets.

item.title: Why a 5% 10-year Treasury yield could be a buying opportunity
item.description: Investors may look back and “see points in time” when Treasury yields were approaching 5% and investors should have been buying, according to PGIM’s h...

item.title: Sterling Could Fall Further as Investors Cut Long Positions Even More
item.description: The global bond market selloff has spread to gilts and prompted investors to trim overweight sterling positions, ING said, but it expects the rise in ...

item.title: Consider flipping your 60/40 portfolio to 40/60 as bonds become more attractive than stocks
item.description: It’s no longer the glory days for the classic 60/40 investment strategy.
